खाली समय का कैसे उपयोग करें?.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "समय का, अपने सारे संसाधनों का सार्थक उपयोग करो, फिर इन सब चीज़ों के लिए समय नहीं मिलेगा। ये सब नशे, ये सब आदतें उनको ही पकड़ती हैं जिनके पास खाली समय बहुत होता है। तुम्हें काम चाहिए। ऐसा काम जो जिस्म तोड़ दे बिल्कुल तुम्हारा। ऐसा काम जो तुम्हारे मन को बिल्कुल जकड़ ले।"
insights.article_title: पॉर्न देखने की लत कैसे छूटे? || आचार्य प्रशांत (2018)

insights.quote: "खाली समय है। इसीलिए सिंधु की मिट्टी में, गंगा की मिट्टी में, यमुना की मिट्टी में धर्म उपजा, क्योंकि खाली समय था।"
insights.article_title: झूठ से फ़ुर्सत पा लो, फिर सच की बात करना || आचार्य प्रशांत (2018)

insights.quote: "आपका सबसे बड़ा दुश्मन आपका खाली समय है और दिक्क़त ये है कि हम सोचते हैं कि हमने बड़ी तरक्की और उपलब्धि कर ली अगर अब हमें खाली समय मिलने लगा है।"
insights.article_title: व्यर्थ के विचारों से बचो || आचार्य प्रशांत, श्रीमद्भगवद्गीता पर (2022)

insights.quote: "खाली समय मिलने वाला है और खाली समय बहुत बड़ी चुनौती की तरह आ रहा है।"
insights.article_title: हफ़्ते में चार दिन काम, बाकी आराम || आचार्य प्रशांत, वेदांत महोत्सव (2022)

insights.quote: "जो भी करो अपने खाली समय में, लेकिन बैठे-बैठे अब तुम देखे जा रहे हो टीवी और टीवी में भी फालतू कचरा देख रहे हो — ये बेहूदी बात है।"
insights.article_title: एक-सौ-चालीस करोड़ लोग, और गोल्ड एक! || (2021)

खाली समय का कैसे उपयोग करें?.footer: इन उद्धरणों से स्पष्ट होता है कि आचार्य जी खाली समय का उपयोग सार्थक कार्यों में करने की सलाह देते हैं, ताकि यह समय व्यर्थ न जाए।

क्या साधारण जीवन जीना आध्यात्मिकता के खि.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "आप एक साधारण जीवन भी जी सकते हो। पर अगर साधारण जीवन में तुमको चैन ही मिलता होता, तो तुम यहाँ क्यों होते?"
insights.article_title: अध्यात्म तुम्हारी खुशी के लिए नहीं, मुक्ति के लिए है || आचार्य प्रशांत (2019)

insights.quote: "आवश्यकता है न उसके पार जाने की? अध्यात्म को कभी जीवन का अंग मत बना लेना। वो तुम्हें सुख और *कंफर्ट* (आराम) देने के लिए नहीं है। अध्यात्म जीवन की बुनियाद होता है, जीवन का हिस्सा नहीं होता।"
insights.article_title: अध्यात्म तुम्हारी खुशी के लिए नहीं, मुक्ति के लिए है || आचार्य प्रशांत (2019)

insights.quote: "जीवन धार्मिक नहीं है तो कुछ नहीं है, मारपीट, लूट-खसोट, इसको नोच लिया, इससे ये किया।"
insights.article_title: कुछ नाम: जिन्होंने प्रेम का आखिरी मूल्य चुकाया (आप नहीं जानते इन्हें?) || आचार्य प्रशांत (2023)

insights.quote: "अध्यात्म का साधारण सामाजिक नैतिकता से लगभग छत्तीस का आँकड़ा है। आम संसारी जिन नैतिक आदर्शों पर चलता है, आध्यात्मिकता उनकी धज्जियाँ उड़ा देती है।"
insights.article_title: (गीता-15) कृष्ण ज़रूरी नहीं हैं, हम तो अपने अनुभवों से सीखेंगे || आचार्य प्रशांत, भगवद् गीता (2022)

insights.quote: "आप अभी जैसा जीवन जी रहे हो, वो बहुत प्रदूषित जीवन है; उसमें तमाम तरह के दोष हैं, पीड़ाएँ हैं, बन्धन हैं।"
insights.article_title: ये सीधा-सादा बंदा तो बहुत टेढ़ा निकला || आचार्य प्रशांत (2021)

क्या साधारण जीवन जीना आध्यात्मिकता के खि.footer: इन उद्धरणों से स्पष्ट होता है कि साधारण जीवन जीना आध्यात्मिकता के खिलाफ नहीं है, बल्कि आध्यात्मिकता का उद्देश्य साधारण जीवन से परे जाकर गहराई में जाना है।

सांसारिक काम करते हुए अध्यात्म के साथ कै.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "सांसारिक कर्म आप कर ही नहीं रहे हैं। सांसारिक कर्म हो रहे हैं अपनेआप। मूल भ्रम यही है कि सांसारिक कर्म करने वाले आप हैं। इन्द्रियाँ हैं, मस्तिष्क है, बुद्धि है, अंतःकरण है, स्मृति है, ये सब अपना काम करना बख़ूबी जानते हैं।"
insights.article_title: सांसारिक काम करते हुए अध्यात्म के साथ कैसे रहें?

insights.quote: "अध्यात्म वो चीज़ है जो काम ही तब करती है जब हृदयस्थ कर लो, नहीं तो काम नहीं करती। न अध्यात्म से घर टूटते हैं, न बच्चे भूखे मरते हैं, न किसी का बुरा होता है। कल्याण का एकमेव साधन है अध्यात्म।"
insights.article_title: जीवन को नया कैसे बनाएँ? || आचार्य प्रशांत (2019)

insights.quote: "अध्यात्म का अर्थ है कि पता हो कि गृहस्थ होने में और आत्मस्थ होने में कोई विशेष अंतर नहीं है। और जो आत्मस्थ हुए बिना गृहस्थ है वो अपने घर का सत्यानाश ही करेगा।"
insights.article_title: ऐसी है बिना अध्यात्म की गृहस्थी || आचार्य प्रशांत (2020)

insights.quote: "जीव को पार्थिव तौर पर तो संसार में ही जीना है न। संसार में ही जीने के बोधपूर्ण, होशपूर्ण, प्रेमपूर्ण रास्ते को सत्य का रास्ता कहा जाता है।"
insights.article_title: संसार में जीने के सही तरीके को अध्यात्म कहते हैं || आचार्य प्रशांत (2019)

insights.quote: "आपको सांसारिक ज्ञान इतना होना चाहिए कि आपकी मूलभूत, शारीरिक और सामाजिक आवश्यकताएँ पूरी होती रहें ताकि आप ज़िन्दगी में, सार्थक, ऊँचे उद्देश्य पर अपना समय ध्यान लगा सकें।"
insights.article_title: मैं पढ़ना नहीं चाहती || आचार्य प्रशांत, वेदांत महोत्सव ऋषिकेश में (2021)

सांसारिक काम करते हुए अध्यात्म के साथ कै.footer: इन उद्धरणों से यह स्पष्ट होता है कि सांसारिक कार्य करते हुए भी अध्यात्म को अपने जीवन में समाहित किया जा सकता है।

असली सुंदरता और असली ताक़त क्या है?.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "ये जो देह की सुंदरता है, जिसकी तुम बात कर रही हो, यही स्त्रियों का बहुत बड़ा बंधन है। और जब तक स्त्री अपनी देह की प्राकृतिक सुंदरता के बंधन से आगे नहीं बढ़ेगी, तब तक वो संसार में अपनी हस्ती, अपना वजूद, अपनी ताकत स्थापित नहीं कर पाएगी।"
insights.article_title: सुंदरता - बात नाज़ की, या लाज की? || आचार्य प्रशांत (2020)

insights.quote: "ज्ञान है आपकी असली ताकत; आपका कौशल आपकी असली ताकत है; आपने दुनिया कितनी देखी है, आपका अनुभव कितना है, ये आपकी असली ताकत है।"
insights.article_title: सुंदरता - बात नाज़ की, या लाज की? || आचार्य प्रशांत (2020)

insights.quote: "अगर शरीर की भी सुंदरता की बात करनी है, तो शरीर की सुंदरता है शरीर की ताकत, फिटनेस। शरीर ताकतवर रखो, फिट रखो।"
insights.article_title: सुंदरता - बात नाज़ की, या लाज की? || आचार्य प्रशांत (2020)

insights.quote: "गाड़ी तुम्हारी होनी चाहिए, स्टेरिंग भी तुम्हारे हाथ में होना चाहिए।"
insights.article_title: आपकी असली ताक़त || आचार्य प्रशांत के नीम लड्डू

insights.quote: "तन को मज़बूत बनाइए, बुद्धि को धार दीजिए और मन को अध्यात्म दीजिए।"
insights.article_title: कहीं उनका किसी से कुछ चल तो नहीं रहा? || आचार्य प्रशांत कार्यशाला (2023)

social media addiction से कैसे बचें?.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "Addicted to Facebook, you are a slave to all the content that is there on Facebook that you watch. And if due to pressure from some quarter you deactivate your Facebook account, then you are still a slave—slave to the direction from where the pressure came."
insights.article_title: Thinking to quit social media? || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "The only thing that determines whether time or money or any other resource available to you is wasted or properly utilized, is whether it aided your liberation. Anything that contributes to your liberation is a thing well utilized. Anything that impedes your liberation is a thing badly wasted."
insights.article_title: Using or abusing social media?  || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "You have to first of all respect the facts of your addictions; they are doing you some good. Those things you are addicted to exist because you have nothing better in your life."
insights.article_title: Addicted to Something? The Final Solution Is This

insights.quote: "You are the one going to those things. Why are you going to those things? That is what spirituality is about—look into yourself. Why do you need to go to those things?"
insights.article_title: Addicted to Something? The Final Solution Is This

insights.quote: "If you do not have Facebook, then this tendency will seek refuge in something else. Facebook was not always there, then the neighbors were there, then other chatting circles were there, or the telephones were there."
insights.article_title: Is social media the culprit? || (2018)

insights.quote: "The same social media can also be the vehicle of precious knowledge to you. It is not social media to be blamed. It is the ‘I’, the tendency that goes to the social media."
insights.article_title: Is social media the culprit? || (2018)

insights.quote: "Temptations, addictions, distractions—none of these can be avoided if you do not have a great central purpose in life to love."
insights.article_title: All addictions vanish when this happens || Acharya Prashant, at Mithibai College Mumbai (2022)

insights.quote: "When better things are possible in life, why settle for lowly ones? Makes no sense, right?"
insights.article_title: Addicted to Something? The Final Solution Is This

social media addiction से कैसे बचें?.footer: इन बिंदुओं के माध्यम से, आचार्य जी ने हमें यह समझाया है कि सोशल मीडिया की लत से बचने के लिए हमें अपने अंदर की प्रवृत्तियों को समझना और एक उच्च उद्देश्य की ओर ध्यान केंद्रित करना आवश्यक है।

मेरी भावनाएँ मुझे क्यों नियंत्रित करती ह.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "भावनाएँ पूरी तरह कंडीशंड हैं। भावनाएँ बहुत गहरी कंडीश्निंग हैं। विचार जितनी बड़ी कंडीश्निंग है, भावनाएँ उससे ज़्यादा बड़ी कंडीश्निंग है।"
insights.article_title: धोखा भावनाओं का

insights.quote: "आपकी भावनाएँ बहकाकर के कोई भी आपको नियंत्रित कर लेता है, गाय बना देता है।"
insights.article_title: आँचल में है दूध और आँखों में पानी || आचार्य प्रशांत के नीम लड्डू

insights.quote: "भावनाएँ तुम्हें चैतन्य नहीं बनाती, भावनाएँ तो बहुत यांत्रिक बात है।"
insights.article_title: होश का असली अर्थ क्या है, और क्या नहीं? || आचार्य प्रशांत (2018)

insights.quote: "जिसने भावनाओं से मुक्ति पा ली, जिसने भावनाओं को महत्व देना कम कर दिया, उस आदमी ने एक बड़ी लड़ाई जीत ली।"
insights.article_title: धोखा भावनाओं का

insights.quote: "आप ये कर सकती हैं कि दुःख कितना भी रहे, भावनाएँ कुछ भी कहें, जो उचित हैं वो आप करती चलिए।"
insights.article_title: रिश्ते और भावनाएँ || आचार्य प्रशांत, वेदांत महोत्सव (2022)

मेरी भावनाएँ मुझे क्यों नियंत्रित करती ह.footer:
। 

इन उद्धरणों से स्पष्ट होता है कि आचार्य जी भावनाओं को एक प्रकार की कंडीशनिंग मानते हैं, जो व्यक्ति को नियंत्रित कर सकती हैं।

आत्मा और मन में क्या अंतर है?.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "आत्मा तो सर्व शक्तिशाली है, उसके अलावा कोई और है नहीं, वो अनंत है तो उसके पास यह शक्ति भी है कि वह खेल-खेल में, क्रीडा में, लीला में स्वयं को भुला दे, तो तब वह कहलाती है मन।"
insights.article_title: आत्मा: कई सवाल || (2020)

insights.quote: "आत्मा माने सच्चाई। आत्मा माने वो चीज़ जिसको कितना भी जाँच-परख लो, तुम्हें अगल-अलग परिणाम नहीं मिल सकते। आत्मा माने कुछ ऐसा जो समय के साथ बदल नहीं सकता, आत्मा माने कुछ ऐसा जो तुम्हें कभी धोखा नही देगा।"
insights.article_title: अवतारों की सच्चाई जानो || आचार्य प्रशांत (2021)

insights.quote: "मन समझ लो प्रकृति है। आत्मा है और मन है, प्रकृति और सत्य है, यही दो हैं।"
insights.article_title: आत्मा: कई सवाल || (2020)

insights.quote: "आत्मा और मन में अंतर यह है कि आत्मा एक है और मन भुलक्कड़ रूप है।"
insights.article_title: आत्मा: कई सवाल || (2020)

insights.quote: "आत्मा मन का अंत है।"
insights.article_title: मन, साक्षित्व, और आत्मा || आचार्य प्रशांत (2018)

आत्मा और मन में क्या अंतर है?.footer: इन उद्धरणों से स्पष्ट होता है कि आत्मा और मन के बीच एक गहरा अंतर है, जहाँ आत्मा स्थायी और सत्य है, जबकि मन परिवर्तनशील और भुलक्कड़ है।

मैं अकेला क्यों महसूस करता हूँ?.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "तुम्हें अकेलापन लगता है दूसरों के संदर्भ में। तुम्हें अकेलापन लगता है जब तुम्हें भीड़ दिखाई देती है, जब तुम्हें भीड़ दिखाई देती है तब तुम कहते हो कि ‘मैं अकेला हूँ’।"
insights.article_title: जैसा जीवन वैसी मृत्यु || आचार्य प्रशांत (2017)

insights.quote: "अकेलापन डरावनी बात नहीं है, अकेलापन सबसे मधुर, सबसे प्यारी, सबसे प्राणदायी बात है। अकेलापन ज़िंदगी देता है।"
insights.article_title: शान्ति और सुविधा में अंतर || (2018)

insights.quote: "अकेला तो अहम् रह ही नहीं सकता न, अहम् का मतलब ही है चिपकने वाली गोंद। ऐसी वृत्ति जो अकेलापन बर्दाश्त ही नहीं कर सकती।"
insights.article_title: संगति का प्रभाव तो होगा ही || आचार्य प्रशांत (2019)

insights.quote: "अकेलापन अनुभव हो, उसके लिए भी थोड़ा होश, थोड़ी चेतना चाहिए न?"
insights.article_title: जहाँ आसक्ति वहाँ दुःख || श्रीमद्भगवद्गीता पर (2020)

insights.quote: "तुम अपनी बेचैनी को अनुभव तो करो। तुम तो अपनी बेचैनी को दबाए रहते हो।"
insights.article_title: तुम सत्य हो, संभावना नहीं || आचार्य प्रशांत, युवाओं के संग (2013)

मैं अकेला क्यों महसूस करता हूँ?.footer: इन उद्धरणों से यह स्पष्ट होता है कि अकेलापन एक अनुभव है जो दूसरों के संदर्भ में महसूस होता है और यह एक गहरी समझ और चेतना की आवश्यकता रखता है।

जीवन का उद्देश्य क्या है?.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "जीवन का एक ही उद्देश्य है: जीवन से मुक्ति। ठीक जैसे बीमारी का एक ही हश्र हो सकता है, बीमारी से मुक्ति।"
insights.article_title: शरीर माने मृत्यु || आचार्य प्रशांत, संत कबीर पर (2014)

insights.quote: "जीवन का एक ही तो उद्देश्य है कि जिस ग्रंथि के साथ पैदा हुईं, जिस बीमारी के साथ पैदा हुईं, जिस भ्रम के साथ पैदा हुईं, जो भ्रमित इकाई को लगता है वो पैदा हुई वो मिटे।"
insights.article_title: घड़ियाली दियो निकाल नी || आचार्य प्रशांत, बाबा बुल्लेशाह पर (2017)

insights.quote: "जीवन का उद्देश्य बस इतना ही है कि उसमें कुछ उद्देश्य तलाशो ही मत।"
insights.article_title: जीवन जीने का सही तरीका क्या है? || आचार्य प्रशान्त (2016)

insights.quote: "जहाँ तकलीफ़ है वहाँ उद्देश्य है। जहाँ तकलीफ़ है वहाँ उद्देश्य है।"
insights.article_title: मानव जीवन का उद्देश्य क्या? अगर हालात बस में न हों तो? || आचार्य प्रशांत (2018)

insights.quote: "जीवन इसलिए दिया गया है ताकि जीवन के पार जा सको।"
insights.article_title: मौत से बचने का तरीक़ा || आचार्य प्रशांत, सूफ़ी कथा पर (2018)

insights.quote: "जीवन का यही उद्देश्य है और कुछ नहीं कि जैसा पैदा हुए थे वैसे ही मर न जाओ।"
insights.article_title: मौत से बचने का तरीक़ा || आचार्य प्रशांत, सूफ़ी कथा पर (2018)

जीवन का उद्देश्य क्या है?.footer: इन उद्धरणों से स्पष्ट होता है कि आचार्य जी जीवन के उद्देश्य को मुक्ति और आत्मज्ञान के संदर्भ में देखते हैं।

धर्म क्या है?.header: इस विषय पर आचार्य जी ने हमें निम्नलिखित बातें बतायी हैं:

insights.quote: "जो कुछ आपके मन को खोल दे, उसे मुक्ति के पंख दे दे, उसका नाम है- धर्म। और जो कुछ भी मनसा को कुंद कर दे, मन की, बोध की और विचारणा की शक्ति को हर ले, उसका नाम है-अधर्म।"
insights.article_title: आम जीवन को आध्यात्मिक कैसे बनाएं? || आचार्य प्रशांत, युवाओं के संग (2017)

insights.quote: "धर्म का मतलब होता है वह धारणा रखना, जो तुम्हें समस्त धारणाओं से मुक्ति दे दे।"
insights.article_title: धर्म का क्या अर्थ?

insights.quote: "धर्म वो धारणा है जो अहंकार को खत्म कर देती है। तो धर्म आखिरी धारणा है।"
insights.article_title: स्वधर्म क्या है? || आचार्य प्रशांत, श्रीकृष्ण पर (2018)

insights.quote: "धर्म का उद्देश्य ये नहीं होता कि अपनी संख्या बढ़ाओ। ... मन को शांति की ओर, या कह दीजिए आत्मा की ओर ले जाना ही धर्म है।"
insights.article_title: सनातन धर्म क्या है? सनातनी किसे मानें? (पूर्ण सत्र) || आचार्य प्रशांत, कार्यशाला (2023)

insights.quote: "धर्म का अर्थ है जानना स्वयं को। अतः ये जानना कि मेरे लिए क्या धारण करना उचित है।"
insights.article_title: आम जीवन को आध्यात्मिक कैसे बनाएं? || आचार्य प्रशांत, युवाओं के संग (2017)

insights.quote: "धर्म हमेशा मन के लिए होता है। और धर्म क्या होता है? मन को अमन तक ले जाना, मन को शून्य, शान्ति तक ले जाना – यही धर्म होता है।"
insights.article_title: धर्म – एक भी, अनेक भी || आचार्य प्रशांत, श्रीमद्भगवद्गीता पर (2022)

insights.quote: "एक ही धर्म है, वो जो वापस आपको आपके घर तक ले जाए, जो मन को आत्मा तक ले जाए, जो अहंकार को परमात्मा तक ले जाए। वही धर्म है, उसके अलावा धर्म नहीं।"
insights.article_title: मंदिरों में जाने के लाभ और नुकसान

define love.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "That state of mind which remains untouched by all the movements in time and space is unconditional, and that alone is Love."
insights.article_title: Unconditional love is a fierce commitment to reject all but the One || Acharya Prashant (2014)

insights.quote: "The purest definition of love is, when the mind is very-very joyful then that joy shows up in all your relationships. Love is your internal joy spilling over."
insights.article_title: Love is letting yourself be absolutely free || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "Love is not a relationship with the other. Love is not a behaviour displayed to others. Love is your internal fullness. Love is the submergence of the ego in its source."
insights.article_title: Love is not just an external action. When Truth shines within, Love is its radiation. || Acharya Prashant (2015)

insights.quote: "Love is simply peace—that which you really like. Your greatest liking is love."
insights.article_title: God is a cat || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Love is the pull that the mind experiences towards peace, towards a final attainment – that is love."
insights.article_title: God is a cat || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "When you really love yourself, then you realize that your welfare and the welfare of the world are inseparable."
insights.article_title: This is Not Love

insights.quote: "Love is not about trying to find love. Love is about letting yourself absolutely free!"
insights.article_title: Love is letting yourself be absolutely free || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

define love.footer: These quotes encapsulate Acharya Prashant's understanding of love as an internal state of joy, peace, and connection to one's true self, rather than merely an external relationship or emotion.

define god.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "God is neither benevolent nor malevolent, neither full of pity nor full of spite. God is an absolute giver. He has given you absolute freedom."
insights.article_title: Why does God allow so much evil in the world?

insights.quote: "There is no God. Hence, God cannot appear real. God does not exist in the conventional sense of the word 'existence'. God does not exist at all."
insights.article_title: We know only one God, and that is ego || (2016)

insights.quote: "God is just the center and source, creation depends on the mind."
insights.article_title: Worldly man- Slave of destiny || Acharya Prashant (2014)

insights.quote: "God is not some creator sitting elsewhere. God is very much in the creation itself."
insights.article_title: Why does God allow so much evil in the world?

insights.quote: "God is a ‘beyondness’. God is that which cannot be touched, not spoiled."
insights.article_title: Man living godly is the only real proof of God || Acharya Prashant, on 'The Fountainhead' (2019)

insights.quote: "The world as you perceive it is your own creation."
insights.article_title: Why Is God so Biased?

define god.footer: These quotes encapsulate Acharya Prashant's perspective on the concept of God, emphasizing the non-traditional and non-anthropomorphic understanding of divinity.

define joy.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Joy is not something that you can think of as something wonderful. Joy is nothing that you can conceptualize as being pleasurable. Joy is just an absence, nothing special; very ordinary, very blank, very empty."
insights.article_title: What is Joy?

insights.quote: "Joy is not a product of conditioning, joy is not a product of anything, joy does not depend upon situations, and joy is not stupid. Joy is reasonless!"
insights.article_title: Happiness cannot be the purpose of life

insights.quote: "Joy is the love affair of life with death."
insights.article_title: Joy is the love affair of life with death || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Happiness is when you have something with you that makes you feel happy. Joy is when you do not need anything in particular to feel happy."
insights.article_title: Happiness versus Joy || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Joy is not a doing. Joy is in fact an act of non-doing."
insights.article_title: How to find joy? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "Joy is always there, obfuscated; hence it is the absence of obfuscation."
insights.article_title: What is Joy?

define joy.footer: These quotes encapsulate Acharya Prashant's understanding of joy as a profound state of being that transcends conventional happiness.

define happiness.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Happiness comes to you so that you become interested, you become inquisitive, your longing gains depth and you ask for permanent happiness."
insights.article_title: Ananda: The Journey Beyond Superficial Happiness

insights.quote: "Real happiness is self-sufficient. Real happiness does not depend upon an object or an event."
insights.article_title: Real happiness is Self-sufficient || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "Happiness is when you have something with you that makes you feel happy. Joy is when you do not need anything in particular to feel happy."
insights.article_title: Happiness versus Joy || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "The common happiness that we know has two characteristics: One, it is an acquired conditioning. And second, it depends on the presence of sadness."
insights.article_title: Happiness cannot be the purpose of life

insights.quote: "Joy is not a product of conditioning, joy is not a product of anything, joy does not depend upon situations, and joy is not stupid. Joy is reasonless!"
insights.article_title: Happiness cannot be the purpose of life

insights.quote: "Happiness is a false medicine. A substitute. A cheap, unworthy substitute for joy."
insights.article_title: Happiness Is a False Medicine

insights.quote: "The deeper is your anxiety, the more happy you will feel."
insights.article_title: Want to Be Happy? Become Sad!

define happiness.footer: These quotes encapsulate Acharya Prashant's perspective on happiness and its distinction from joy.

what does bhagvad gita say about dharma?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Dharma is not a special presence of the extra-ordinary. Dharma is the absence of illusion, ignorance, etc which are mostly found in normality. Stay here; do what is needed. For that is Dharma. Be here; do the needful. For that is what you must do."
insights.article_title: Bhagavad Gita Quotes, Chapter 1, The Grief of Arjun

insights.quote: "Dharma is continuous remembrance of place value. Do not just count the amount; see to whom the amount is dedicated to. It is not quantity that matters. It is the place of quantity that provides quality to the quantity."
insights.article_title: Bhagavad Gita Quotes, Chapter 1, The Grief of Arjun

insights.quote: "Dharma lies in fighting Duryodhana. In what does Swadharma lie? Swadharma lies in fighting Duryodhana like a Kshatriya."
insights.article_title: What is Dharma According to the Bhagavad Gita?

insights.quote: "Dharma is the same for everybody, but Swadharma varies according to your physical, social, temporal conditions."
insights.article_title: What is Dharma According to the Bhagavad Gita?

insights.quote: "Dharma is like an internal adhesive. It keeps all parts of you whole, in sync, centered. Dharma is the parts not being at cross purposes with each other."
insights.article_title: Bhagavad Gita Quotes, Chapter 1, The Grief of Arjun

insights.quote: "Duryodhana has realized that he is siding with adharma and Pandavas are siding with Dharma i.e. Shri Krishna."
insights.article_title: Bhagavad Gita Quotes, Chapter 1, The Grief of Arjun

insights.quote: "Don't oppose the Truth for so long and with great determination, that it becomes impossible for you to retreat your steps. Never let yourself come to that place. Even Truth cannot save you if you violate the Truth."
insights.article_title: Bhagavad Gita Quotes, Chapter 1, The Grief of Arjun

what does bhagvad gita say about dharma?.footer: These quotes encapsulate the essence of Dharma as discussed in the Bhagavad Gita according to Acharya Prashant's commentary.

how can one build resilience and inner s.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Now the point within is gaining strength; it does not even demand any protection. It is saying, 'Yes, you can take a little more, I am not threatened. You can bear more, I am not threatened.'"
insights.article_title: All this is Brahman alone || On Mundaka Upanishad (2021)

insights.quote: "That vulnerability is not your weakness. That vulnerability is a demonstration of your inner strength. You are taking it because you *can* take it."
insights.article_title: All this is Brahman alone || On Mundaka Upanishad (2021)

insights.quote: "As you are, first of all you must learn to resist and protect. Slowly, the need to resist and the need to protect will reduce. As it reduces, you gain in freedom."
insights.article_title: All this is Brahman alone || On Mundaka Upanishad (2021)

insights.quote: "You have to fight against yourself; you have to win the inner battle."
insights.article_title: Are you helping the right person in the right way? || Acharya Prashant, on Bhagwad Gita (2020)

insights.quote: "If you keep waiting for strength before getting into the fight, then you will never have the strength to put up any fight."
insights.article_title: Unlock your potential || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Pain is a conspiracy. That’s why it has to be faced and destroyed."
insights.article_title: The marks of the right seeking and the rewards of the right seeker || On Mundaka Upanishad (2021)

insights.quote: "You must have power over your own mind. You must have power over all the influences that are trying to capture your mind."
insights.article_title: Unlocking Your Internal Superhuman : Will to Power | Acharya Prashant | TEDxAKGEC

insights.quote: "You do what is right. Don’t think so much of your capability or resources. Once you start doing what is right, you find that the resources have been unlocked for you."
insights.article_title: Unlock your potential || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "You are so strong that you can bear all hurt."
insights.article_title: One is enslaved with her own consent || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "If one can be attuned to that point within, if one can be affiliated to that point within, if one can be in love with that thing within, then life becomes not only bearable but actually joyful."
insights.article_title: Empowered Decision Making for Student Life: Acharya Prashant

how are spirituality and religion differ.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Fundamentally there is no difference, no difference at all, but at a practical level a difference seems to arise and the difference is, that religion assumes an organized shape. Even spirituality can become organized but, religion is much more prone to organization."
insights.article_title: Are Religion and spirituality same?

insights.quote: "Spirituality assumes a much more open and accommodative route, religion gives a much more planned and organized route."
insights.article_title: Are Religion and spirituality same?

insights.quote: "Religion is for the one who is far away from the temple, as most people are. So, they need loud and harsh worldly reminders in their language to come to the temple."
insights.article_title: Godliness is the heart of spirituality, and religion is its body || On Advait Vedanta (2019)

insights.quote: "Spirituality is subtle. Religion is gross."
insights.article_title: The relation between religion and spirituality || Acharya Prashant (2018)

insights.quote: "Religion is the outermost shell of spirituality. It is there so that the uninitiated ones might be somehow introduced to the basic principles, and initiated on that long road that passes through, firstly spirituality and then ends in liberation."
insights.article_title: Hollow Veganism || Acharya Prashant, in Conversation (2022)

insights.quote: "Spirituality is not at all organised religion. It is not about customs or rituals or beliefs. Spirituality is an awakened state of mind in which the mind really understands."
insights.article_title: What is Spirituality?

insights.quote: "Religion is that which brings you to your center of peace; not the center of disturbance, or violence."
insights.article_title: Celebrate Diwali as a True Religion

how are spirituality and religion differ.footer: These quotes illustrate the nuanced differences between spirituality and religion as articulated by Acharya Prashant.

what strategies lead to excellence in li.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "One has to then go beyond it. Then one has to aim for something higher than success. Then one has to ask, 'What is it that matters more than success?'"
insights.article_title: How to succeed in getting a good quality life? || Acharya Prashant (2019)

insights.quote: "You have to ask yourself, 'How much better I am compared to what I was yesterday?' You are on your own individual journey. It is not possible or wise to compare yourself against others."
insights.article_title: Acharya Prashant on Rising Above Mediocrity

insights.quote: "You must have a very, very high purpose in life, the kind of purpose that can never actually be fully attained."
insights.article_title: Why an IITian loses focus, and the purpose of life || IIT Kharagpur (2021)

insights.quote: "Before you excel, ask yourself, 'What must I excel in? What is worth it?'"
insights.article_title: Effect of repeated failures on the self

insights.quote: "Making the perfect choice is far more important than being perfect at the perfect choice."
insights.article_title: Effect of repeated failures on the self

insights.quote: "You have to know what you are doing. Once you know what you are doing, then the knowledge itself is the motivator."
insights.article_title: How to remain motivated and excel every moment?

insights.quote: "The first thing is the choice itself. Choose the right road, and then obviously you’ve to create and invent means to speedily travel down that road."
insights.article_title: Enquiry before Devotion || Acharya Prashant, with IIM Nagpur (2022)

what strategies lead to excellence in li.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-awareness, purpose, and the right choices in the pursuit of excellence in life.

how can i stop obsessing over someone?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "The best act of hatred, real hatred, pure hatred, would lie in forgiving and forgetting."
insights.article_title: Stop hating your ex || Acharya Prashant, at Delhi University (2023)

insights.quote: "If you are still hating someone, it means you still have a very strong relationship. Such a strong relationship, you are preserving that person in your mind. Is that hate? No, that's worship."
insights.article_title: Stop hating your ex || Acharya Prashant, at Delhi University (2023)

insights.quote: "The only way to get rid of the relationship absolutely is by raising your game—raise the level of your consciousness."
insights.article_title: Stop hating your ex || Acharya Prashant, at Delhi University (2023)

insights.quote: "You do not want a person, so that he may cause you disturbance. When you want a person, you actually want peace and contentment through that person, don’t you?"
insights.article_title: How to Recover From a Breakup? || Acharya Prashant (2017)

insights.quote: "Contentment is more valuable than any relationship. Relationships are a medium, contentment is the end."
insights.article_title: How to Recover From a Breakup? || Acharya Prashant (2017)

insights.quote: "If life is benevolent enough to offer you a great, great companion, nothing like it. But if you cannot have a great companion, live all by yourself."
insights.article_title: Wasting Life on an Unworthy Person?

how can i stop obsessing over someone?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-awareness, raising one's consciousness, and prioritizing inner peace over attachment to others.

why is eating animals unethical but eati.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Eating an apple and eating an animal are not the same thing. The apple is not crying for salvation; the apple is not crying for freedom—but the animal hates to be caged."
insights.article_title: Is eating animals the same as eating plants, because plants too have life?

insights.quote: "If you are drawing a line, why must only human beings be beyond the line? Why can’t you be more discreet in keeping somebody out of bounds? Right now, you are drawing the line in such a way that animals are within the edible territory and human beings are outside the line, they have been exempted."
insights.article_title: Is eating animals the same as eating plants, because plants too have life?

insights.quote: "The best thing, the dream, the utopia would be a situation in which man can survive without even killing a single plant; fruits, vegetables and leaves would suffice."
insights.article_title: May this happen one day || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Violence is only when you deliberately kill. If killing is happening because it is unavoidable, then it is not violence."
insights.article_title: Respect the form that takes you to the Formless || On Advait Vedanta (2019)

insights.quote: "You don’t eat human beings because human beings are conscious, because human beings are hungry of liberation. And consciousness is your only hope and consciousness is your only savior."
insights.article_title: The only thing that deserves respect ||Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Even a vegetarian diet involves a certain level of violence. But then, that is the very basic minimum violence that you have to do because you carry a body."
insights.article_title: What Makes You Do This?

why is eating animals unethical but eati.footer: These quotes reflect Acharya Prashant's perspective on the ethical considerations surrounding the consumption of animals versus plants.

how can i stop thinking about masturbati.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "When the inner energy has gone mad, there are only two options left - either to go fully mad or to give that energy the highest expression, the highest vent, the highest exit."
insights.article_title: How to overcome masturbation addiction?

insights.quote: "Fill up your day, your time, your mind with the highest. Let the truly deserving one occupy you fully."
insights.article_title: How to overcome masturbation addiction?

insights.quote: "Do not give value to the personal. Personal time and personal space is where you are getting conquered, beaten, and destroyed."
insights.article_title: How to overcome masturbation addiction?

insights.quote: "Stop giving that consent. It’s not difficult. Stop giving that consent, that consent is just a pattern that you have created for yourself."
insights.article_title: Be one with the happening, the change will happen || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "The moment you say, 'You are not interested, the energy of the thought crashes, and it’s gone.'"
insights.article_title: To be free, first discover the nature of your bondage || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Use thought, so that thought can stop. Use boat, so that you can get down from the boat."
insights.article_title: How to control thoughts? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "Be cautious of what that thought is about. Look at it and ask yourself, 'Is it needed?'"
insights.article_title: How to control thoughts? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "If you are afraid of the loitering of the mind, it only proves that you are insecure about your own love."
insights.article_title: Is It Love or Lust? How Do You Untangle the Confusion?

how can i stop thinking about masturbati.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of channeling energy positively, being aware of thoughts, and not giving undue importance to personal time or thoughts that lead to restlessness.

how do i quit watching porn?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "When the inner energy has gone mad, there are only two options left - either to go fully mad or to give that energy the highest expression, the highest vent, the highest exit."
insights.article_title: How to overcome masturbation addiction?

insights.quote: "Fill up your day, your time, your mind with the highest. Let the truly deserving one occupy you fully."
insights.article_title: How to overcome masturbation addiction?

insights.quote: "You have to first of all respect the facts of your addictions; they are doing you some good. Those things you are addicted to exist because you have nothing better in your life."
insights.article_title: Addicted to Something? The Final Solution Is This

insights.quote: "What you call as distractions are very intimately related to purposelessness. You cannot be distracted without being purposeless. Have a solid purpose in life and fall in love with it, and all these distractions will vaporize into thin air."
insights.article_title: Addicted to Something? The Final Solution Is This

insights.quote: "Instead of chasing a medicine, pay attention to the disease."
insights.article_title: How to get rid of addictions? || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "The day you go to the craving without any resistance, you will find that the craving has already lost much of its attraction."
insights.article_title: Living with addiction

insights.quote: "You see, when I find out on my own that life must be lived this way, then there can be no guilt associated with that."
insights.article_title: Porn and guilt, physical and social conditioning || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

how do i quit watching porn?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of channeling one's energy towards higher pursuits, understanding the root of addictions, and the necessity of having a purpose in life to overcome distractions.

why do i feel uneasy or unsettled?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "The root of the disturbance is within you. Temporarily, a change of surroundings helps reduce the disturbance, but the mere change in external situations cannot help beyond a point."
insights.article_title: Beware of Fake Depression

insights.quote: "Man is in a very precarious position. Animals are well settled; the free ones, the Buddhas are also well settled. Man is unsettled."
insights.article_title: Why Man is highly Unsettled and Restless

insights.quote: "Your uneasiness is the hint. Stop. Stop and pay attention. Attention is your friend. Attention will expose all the mischiefs."
insights.article_title: If you don’t want fear || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "We are born uneasy, and then there is a lot around us that makes us even more uneasy."
insights.article_title: What Depression Is Not || Acharya Prashant, with IIM Nagpur (2022)

insights.quote: "More often than not, unease is a sign of the approach of Truth."
insights.article_title: With trembling hands || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "The agitation of the mind is not without a reason."
insights.article_title: Strange noises from the engine || Neem Candies

why do i feel uneasy or unsettled?.footer: These insights suggest that feelings of unease or being unsettled often stem from internal disturbances and a lack of true understanding or fulfillment.

how can i control my mind better?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Mind control is not about suppressing the mind. It is about supporting the mind to take the right route and reach the right destination."
insights.article_title: Control Your Mind or It Will Control You

insights.quote: "Nobody has ever really said that the mind needs to be controlled or can be controlled. It is only the control-freaks who talk of this language."
insights.article_title: How to control the mind

insights.quote: "The mind has all the right to wander. If the mind is not wandering, believe me, you are dead."
insights.article_title: How to control the mind

insights.quote: "Stop helping. Your help is your doing. That is what I replied to the question – what to do? 'Not to do.' Do not provide it energy anymore."
insights.article_title: Don't try to control the mind, leave it alone to be quiet || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2015)

insights.quote: "You cannot control the mind, otherwise, it will be a very violent relationship."
insights.article_title: How to prevent distraction of mind? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "Let the mind do, what it wants to do, remain present along with the mind, do not leave it alone."
insights.article_title: How to prevent distraction of mind? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "The mind cannot be controlled. But, yes, you can look at the tendency to control the mind, and wonder whether it is worth it."
insights.article_title: The mind cannot be controlled || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "You are not that which keeps bubbling in your mind."
insights.article_title: Your Best Kept Secret is Out || AP Neem Candies

how can i control my mind better?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of understanding and befriending the mind rather than attempting to control it forcefully.

what are meaningful ways to use my free.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Weekend is the time. Continue to read, continue to advance in some art, some craft, music, dance, trekking, whatsoever appeals to you. Volunteer, that was the first thing I said. Find a worthy place to go to, see how you can contribute there."
insights.article_title: Best Ways to Spend Your Weekends

insights.quote: "Free time is not about somehow completing your classes, coming back to your room, and throwing away the bag and slumping on the couch and saying, 'Now, this is my free time. Where is the remote? I want to watch TV.' This is not free time. This is nonsense time."
insights.article_title: Procrastination vs Having a good time || IIT Kharagpur (2022)

insights.quote: "Time spent in pursuit of freedom, only that is free time. And the free time of the ordinary kind you should have none of."
insights.article_title: Procrastination vs Having a good time || IIT Kharagpur (2022)

insights.quote: "You shouldn’t have even a second of free time. All your time must be occupied in beautiful things."
insights.article_title: Procrastination vs Having a good time || IIT Kharagpur (2022)

insights.quote: "If you can, first of all, see that the process most of us are currently committed to, is not something you'd want to remain with, then there opens up something else."
insights.article_title: How to be happy without depending on others? || (2019)

insights.quote: "When you do something with all your determination, with all your truth, with your total sincerity, and you spend time doing this, then you should say, 'This was my free time.'"
insights.article_title: Procrastination vs Having a good time || IIT Kharagpur (2022)

what are meaningful ways to use my free.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of using free time meaningfully, focusing on personal growth, and engaging in activities that contribute to one's development and well-being.

how do i handle feelings of isolation?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Loneliness, you know, is the best gift that life can offer you. Seriously. If you are not lonely, then the alternative is to be with something terrible."
insights.article_title: Loneliness is a gift || Acharya Prashant, at BITS Pilani, Goa (2022)

insights.quote: "Simply put, loneliness is when you are not alright with yourself. Loneliness is when you are just not okay with yourself."
insights.article_title: A great alternative to loneliness

insights.quote: "When you could not give nice company to yourself, how would you give nice company to the other?"
insights.article_title: A great alternative to loneliness

insights.quote: "Loneliness is a cancer within. By having people around you, your internal cancer does not get treated."
insights.article_title: Only right company can heal your loneliness  || IIT Patna (2021)

insights.quote: "The real way is to know that as long as we continue to feed our false sense of self, we are condemning ourselves to more and more loneliness."
insights.article_title: Emotional dependency and loneliness || Acharya Prashant, with IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "You must learn aloneness before you relate with people. You must be very, very comfortable with yourself."
insights.article_title: Be comfortable in aloneness || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "A healthy relationship with the world is when you do not go and stick to someone or cling to someone, nor do you promote others clinging to you."
insights.article_title: Only right company can heal your loneliness  || IIT Patna (2021)

insights.quote: "When you really, honestly, ruthlessly see, then the rubbish falls. When the rubbish has gone, the need to hunt for company has also gone, which means the loneliness has gone."
insights.article_title: A great alternative to loneliness

how do i handle feelings of isolation?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of understanding and confronting one's feelings of loneliness, recognizing it as an opportunity for self-discovery and growth.

what is the purpose of life?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "See, what you call as life is experienced moment to moment. Even the memories of the past and the imaginations of the future, you experience them in this moment. So, essentially, life is nothing but your experience as it is right now."
insights.article_title: What is the purpose of your life? || Acharya Prashant, at Christ University (2022)

insights.quote: "Finding a solution to the core of your troubles can be the only purpose of life. What else?"
insights.article_title: What is the purpose of your life? || Acharya Prashant, at Christ University (2022)

insights.quote: "Those who have known, have taught us that the purpose of life is to gain freedom from everything that keeps you small."
insights.article_title: What is the purpose of your life? || Acharya Prashant, at Christ University (2022)

insights.quote: "The purpose of life is liberation. There is no other reason why you are born. You are born into suffering, and you want to totally lapse out of suffering."
insights.article_title: Have You Decided Your Goals in Life? || Acharya Prashant

insights.quote: "If life has a purpose, this is the only purpose: To see that all our purposes are just illusions."
insights.article_title: The purpose of life is to come to purposelessness || (2017)

insights.quote: "Life is an opportunity to be free, life is an opportunity to get rid of illusions, and that opportunity remains unutilized."
insights.article_title: One can be purposeless only when the purpose of life has been met || (2019)

insights.quote: "The purpose must be to somehow get out of that job. And that is the purpose for now."
insights.article_title: What Makes You Do This?

insights.quote: "The purpose of life is to be liberated from the obligation to remain troubled all the time."
insights.article_title: What Makes You Do This?

insights.quote: "Be light, be aware, be loving, that is the purpose of life. Simple!"
insights.article_title: What is the purpose of life?  || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "You are here just to ‘be’, to express your core. That’s it, simple."
insights.article_title: Purpose of life || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

what is the purpose of life?.footer: These insights reflect Acharya Prashant's understanding of the purpose of life as a journey towards liberation and self-awareness.

does simple living conflict with spiritu.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Spirituality is not about dropping the real thing; it is about dropping false pleasures so that you can have real joy."
insights.article_title: Exactly who is happy here? || Acharya Prashant, with IIT Bombay (2021)

insights.quote: "Spirituality is for Whom? Spirituality is the most exquisite pursuit. It is not something that you can pick from the shelf, and start practicing."
insights.article_title: Not ripe enough? Keep hanging there

insights.quote: "Renunciation, therefore, is about not clinging to that which is doing you no good."
insights.article_title: Consumption, Contentment, and Climate Crisis || (2021)

insights.quote: "Simple living is: when I look at somebody, I do not look at the makeup, I do not look at the brand of the clothes, I do not look at the expression the fellow is wearing; I look at the essence of the person."
insights.article_title: Are you simple or complex? || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Simplicity is existential. Complexity is man-made."
insights.article_title: Are you simple or complex? || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Spirituality is about knowing why you are restless. Spirituality is about knowing why you resist change."
insights.article_title: Spirituality is the intimacy of the immediate, not the blaze of the beyond || Acharya Prashant(2016)

does simple living conflict with spiritu.footer: These quotes illustrate that simple living and spirituality can coexist, as both emphasize the importance of inner joy and understanding over external complexities and false pleasures.

should i trust emotions or logic in dile.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "It’s not about being emotional versus being logical. Being more logical might help you to an extent, but it is not really the solution to being identified with one’s emotions."
insights.article_title: Do emotions trouble you? || Acharya Prashant (2022)

insights.quote: "Emotions are obviously not a mistake, but emotionality is. Emotions are neither good nor bad. Emotions depend on the center that they are coming from."
insights.article_title: From where are your emotions arising? || Acharya Prashant (2017)

insights.quote: "Let emotion be. Don’t interfere."
insights.article_title: How to control emotions? || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "If you are too emotional, you have lost it. And in trying to control the emotion, you lose it even more."
insights.article_title: How to control emotions? || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Exercise your intellect, your reasoning capability, your analytical capability fully; and when you apply these fully, then the very application of the mind brings the mind to its own boundary."
insights.article_title: The importance of rationality in decision-making || IIT Delhi (2020)

should i trust emotions or logic in dile.footer: These quotes emphasize the importance of understanding and managing emotions rather than simply choosing between emotions and logic.

what should i do when sexual urges arise.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Channelize your desire. You must know what you are really hungry for. Your central and primary desire is not sex. Sex may appear overpowering, tempting, but that is really not what you ultimately want. Figure out what you really must have, and then sex will be assigned automatically, inwardly, its proper place; then sex will not be so much of a big thing for you."
insights.article_title: Stop the rotting feeling inside you || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "When you are in the Truth, when you are not afraid, then every action of yours is a healing action, then every breath of yours cures the entire world. Because you yourself are cured now. You yourself are a healed entity now. Whatever you do is a step in healing."
insights.article_title: Sex That Heals and Sex That Bleeds || AP Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Sex is such a big thing because we think that it is going to take us to the big. It doesn't take us there. So, treat it with a little sanity. They mean a little composed. Do not go overboard. Sex is just sex— that is the first thing."
insights.article_title: What is the energy behind sex? || Acharya Prashant (2017)

insights.quote: "If you can have a life like that, then sex won’t be such a tremendously important thing."
insights.article_title: What Women Really Want

insights.quote: "Sex carries magnificent notions; sex carries the promise of ultimate fulfillment. Don’t you see we are a hyper-sexualized society? That just tells of the inner rot."
insights.article_title: Stop the rotting feeling inside you || Neem Candies

what should i do when sexual urges arise.footer: These insights emphasize understanding one's deeper desires, the importance of healing, and the need to approach sexual urges with a balanced perspective.

what is the essence of zen?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Zen is the simplest, purest, and most direct way of living. Almost living like a plant, living like winds, and stones and animals."
insights.article_title: Zen is the final flowering of all religious ascension || (2016)

insights.quote: "Zen is about seeing that. And once you have seen that, then very honestly you admit it and move on—That’s Zen."
insights.article_title: Zen is the final flowering of all religious ascension || (2016)

insights.quote: "Zen is the final flowering of all religious ascension. Religion and spirituality keep rising and rising. And its final flowering is the silence of Zen."
insights.article_title: Zen is the final flowering of all religious ascension || (2016)

insights.quote: "A clean slate. What else is Zen? A clean plate. You must be totally done with it."
insights.article_title: What is Zen? A clean plate || Acharya Prashant, on Zen (2016)

insights.quote: "Zen is about forsaking both, yes and no, together."
insights.article_title: What is Zen? A clean plate || Acharya Prashant, on Zen (2016)

insights.quote: "Zen is your essential core that reacts not, that it’s his own master. Has it’s own way of living."
insights.article_title: Have you any God? || Acharya Prashant, on Zen (2016)

insights.quote: "The essence of Zen is far beyond methods."
insights.article_title: Zen is the final flowering of all religious ascension || (2016)

what is the essence of zen?.footer: These quotes encapsulate the essence of Zen as understood by Acharya Prashant, emphasizing simplicity, directness, and a profound inner honesty.

how should i deal with boredom?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Boredom comes only when you have an idea of what would not bore you."
insights.article_title: How to let things happen? || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "You feel bored only because you have an image of what would not bore you."
insights.article_title: How to let things happen? || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Boredom is not just ‘boredom’, boredom is preparation for excitement."
insights.article_title: How to let things happen? || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Life will remain boring and dull till the time you avoid coming in contact with it."
insights.article_title: How to Make One’s Parents Proud?

insights.quote: "Boredom is a great indicator. Pay attention to it."
insights.article_title: With all your imperfections, you are Perfect || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "If boredom comes to us, it means that there is something greatly repetitive going on in life."
insights.article_title: With all your imperfections, you are Perfect || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "You are alive, you are throbbing, you don’t want to be dead, so you turn to alcohol, because alcohol, for at least a while, makes you feel alive."
insights.article_title: Living with addiction

how should i deal with boredom?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of understanding the root causes of boredom and engaging fully with life to overcome it.

how can i overcome procrastination and l.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Procrastination is nothing but the postponement of misery. ‘If I do it right now, I will feel miserable.’ So I somehow try to escape by sending the thing into the future."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Procrastination?

insights.quote: "If you find yourself procrastinating a lot of times, if you find that you have fixed a schedule for yourself and you can’t stick to it, then that is a clear indicator that you have filled up your life with miserable tasks."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Procrastination?

insights.quote: "One does not postpone joy. One does not postpone freedom and love. One only postpones suffering. And that is procrastination."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Procrastination?

insights.quote: "Procrastination is always about the future. A mind that is immersed in the present will not procrastinate."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Procrastination?

insights.quote: "When we love what we do, procrastination is out of the question."
insights.article_title: The loving way of life || Acharya Prashant(2019)

insights.quote: "Find out what is it that you will not try to procrastinate and give more of that to yourself."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Procrastination?

insights.quote: "Laziness is just the symptom of the effect of conditioning. Laziness is nothing else."
insights.article_title: Laziness is to be conditioned against a particular activity || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2015)

insights.quote: "When the mind says, 'Oh! I am feeling lazy. I do not want to study,' do not give importance to this statement of the mind."
insights.article_title: Laziness is to be conditioned against a particular activity || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2015)

insights.quote: "Learn to cheat yourself. If you are to be loyal to the Truth, you must learn how to be disloyal to yourself."
insights.article_title: If you are to be loyal to the Truth, learn to be disloyal to yourself || On Advaita Vedanta (2019)

insights.quote: "Procrastinate all that which is nonsensical."
insights.article_title: Procrastinate the nonsense || Neem Candies

how can i overcome procrastination and l.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of understanding the nature of tasks, the role of love and joy in our actions, and the need to cultivate awareness to overcome procrastination and laziness.

how can i stop overthinking?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Overthinking is a kind of imagination. Imagination takes you away from the fact of your life."
insights.article_title: Freedom from anxiety

insights.quote: "To be anxious, you need to be blessed with a lot of spare time. How do you manage time to indulge in anxiety?"
insights.article_title: How to reduce overthinking and anxiety || With IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "Immerse yourself in the right action, then where are space and the time to worry?"
insights.article_title: How to reduce overthinking and anxiety || With IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "If I really understand what is going on, and what is going on is going on right now, then from that understanding action will result; clear, direct, forceful, energetic action."
insights.article_title: Freedom from anxiety

insights.quote: "The mind loves to engage itself with itself. The mind loves to roll in its own stuff."
insights.article_title: Feeling Caged in Your Chattering Mind?

insights.quote: "When you do not have that in your life which is important, when you do not have a sense of the worthy, the result will be that a lot of little things will invade the mind."
insights.article_title: How Can You Stop Overthinking?

how can i stop overthinking?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of focusing on meaningful actions and understanding the nature of thoughts to reduce overthinking and anxiety.

how do i improve focus and concentration.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Attention is possible only in deep, inner silence."
insights.article_title: Truth is not for those who sell their freedom || Acharya Prashant (2013)

insights.quote: "Once you get rid of the enemies of attention, attention is there. You don’t have to get it."
insights.article_title: Truth is not for those who sell their freedom || Acharya Prashant (2013)

insights.quote: "When your mind starts wandering, do not go along with it. Watch it and understand its mechanics."
insights.article_title: Truth is not for those who sell their freedom || Acharya Prashant (2013)

insights.quote: "Attention is fundamentally more about witnessing the mind, and in this witnessing the mind quietens."
insights.article_title: Truth is not for those who sell their freedom || Acharya Prashant (2013)

insights.quote: "You don’t have to bring your mind back from the world to yourself because there is nothing called ‘yourself’."
insights.article_title: Vivekachudamani: Dissolve the Mind by Concentrating It in the Supreme Self

insights.quote: "If you want to become stable, you don’t need to deprive the mind of options; you need to give the mind a beautiful option it can fall in love with."
insights.article_title: I don’t love it, but my parents want me to concentrate on it || Acharya Prashant, at IIT-D (2023)

insights.quote: "The problem of concentration is essentially the problem of an unworthy object."
insights.article_title: I don’t love it, but my parents want me to concentrate on it || Acharya Prashant, at IIT-D (2023)

insights.quote: "Concentration is synonymous with fear and desire."
insights.article_title: Vivekachudamani: Dissolve the Mind by Concentrating It in the Supreme Self

insights.quote: "If you are doing something just for the unadulterated pleasure of doing it, you don’t want something in return; the doing *is* the return."
insights.article_title: How to stay focused on your goal? || Neem Candies

how do i improve focus and concentration.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of understanding the mind's processes, the nature of attention versus concentration, and the significance of having worthy goals to maintain focus.

can i balance material success with spir.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Spirituality does not discard the material, it keeps material at its right place."
insights.article_title: Parents Don't Care for Your Interests?

insights.quote: "Spirituality is the light that enables you to choose rightly between one material and the other."
insights.article_title: On Education, Corporate Life and Career Progress

insights.quote: "You cannot have that kind of division where you put life on one side and Spirituality on the other side."
insights.article_title: On Education, Corporate Life and Career Progress

insights.quote: "If you are not spiritual, the punishment will not be that you will be denied entry into some heaven... The punishment of not being spiritual is that you lead a very bad, a very ruined worldly life."
insights.article_title: Can Money and Spirituality Go Together?

insights.quote: "Good spirituality is, therefore, good economics."
insights.article_title: Can Money and Spirituality Go Together?

insights.quote: "You can have as much money as is needed—but needed for what? That you must be clear about."
insights.article_title: You can't have anything great without having this || Acharya Prashant, with XLRI (2021)

can i balance material success with spir.footer: These quotes illustrate that spirituality and material success are interconnected, and one can achieve a balance by understanding the purpose and value of material pursuits through a spiritual lens.

how do i overcome fear of criticism?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "All fear arises from dependence. If you are not dependent, you cannot be afraid. Whenever you will be dependent, you will always be afraid."
insights.article_title: Let the other never cloud your mind || Acharya Prashant (2014)

insights.quote: "If you want to live fearlessly, then stop being dependent on others. Find out your dependence."
insights.article_title: Why cant I speak in front of others? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "Fear is always related to somebody else, something external, something outside of you."
insights.article_title: To live fearlessly, remove your dependencies || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "Whenever you feel scared, trembling and even hopeful in the presence of the other... just remind yourself that I am being dependent, otherwise I could not have felt this fear."
insights.article_title: Let the other never cloud your mind || Acharya Prashant (2014)

insights.quote: "You may fail a thousand times, still you are alright. There is nothing missing in you."
insights.article_title: Let the other never cloud your mind || Acharya Prashant (2014)

insights.quote: "To understand fear is to be unaffected by it."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Challenges in Decision Making?

insights.quote: "Fear comes out of what you don’t understand. To understand is to conquer fear."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Challenges in Decision Making?

how do i overcome fear of criticism?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-reliance and understanding in overcoming the fear of criticism.

how can i ignore others’ opinions?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "One characteristic of aloneness is a healthy indifference to others’ opinions. You listen to others’ opinions but you are not bogged down by them. You are under no compulsion to grant them affirmation. Others’ opinions are just that—firstly, others’; secondly, opinions."
insights.article_title: Loneliness and Love

insights.quote: "You can have very little control on 'that', the things happening in the world, but you can observe the effect it has on ‘this’, the mind. Because your suffering lies not ‘there’ but ‘here’. You suffer in your mind."
insights.article_title: How do I avoid the comments made by others? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "The trouble is, that we do not have our own eyes. To be more accurate, our eyes are closed. Had we not had any eyes, then the act could be pardonable. But the fact is, we have our eyes and we are keeping them closed."
insights.article_title: How to not get distracted by critics? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "If you are not dependent on others for something or the other, then you have no reason to keep considering what they are thinking, what their opinion of you is, right? The more you are dependent on others, the more you will keep looking at them."
insights.article_title: To be free, first discover the nature of your bondage || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "You will never be hurt if you do not link that opinion to your self-image. You can never ever feel hurt if you do not link other’s opinion to your self-image."
insights.article_title: How to not get distracted by critics? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

how can i ignore others’ opinions?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-awareness and the need to detach from the opinions of others to maintain inner peace and clarity.

is morality influenced by culture and ti.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "You have been given a criterion to look at those actions and that criterion is not yours. Different cultures, different people, different times have different criteria."
insights.article_title: Truth is terrible, morality is sweet || (2016)

insights.quote: "It is not absolute, it is conceptual that is why there is time, age, and place."
insights.article_title: Truth is terrible, morality is sweet || (2016)

insights.quote: "Morality comes from the behaviour of the society you are living in. ‘Mores’ relates to the masses. The way masses behave, that becomes the morality."
insights.article_title: Question Everything: Unlearn for True Freedom! || Acharya Prashant, with IIT-Madras (2023)

insights.quote: "Culture is man-made, and it should keep getting refined episodically, timely—continuously rather not even episodically. Culture is something that pertains to a particular place at a particular moment in time."
insights.article_title: Beware: Culture and Tradition Are Not Your Best Friends

insights.quote: "What is wrong in one country, is right in another country, what is wrong in one house, is considered right in another house, what is wrong in one age, is right in another age."
insights.article_title: Your morality is your bondage || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "If you want to retain culture, then you must retain the culture that was found all across the subcontinent. And also, if you really want to retain the culture that existed in India in the 18th, 19th or 20th centuries, then a lot that you do today will have to be stopped."
insights.article_title: Beware: Culture and Tradition Are Not Your Best Friends

is morality influenced by culture and ti.footer: These quotes illustrate that morality is indeed influenced by culture and time, reflecting the changing norms and values of society.

how do i make ethical choices in complex.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "How important is it to be rational while making decisions? There is no other way. I am assuming that when you say that we need to be rational, you are emphasizing the role of discretion over instinct, reason over emotion."
insights.article_title: The importance of rationality in decision-making || IIT Delhi (2020)

insights.quote: "Exercise your intellect, your reasoning capability, your analytical capability fully; and when you apply these fully, then the very application of the mind brings the mind to its own boundary."
insights.article_title: The importance of rationality in decision-making || IIT Delhi (2020)

insights.quote: "You must go deeper into why you need to choose this way or the other. You must go deeper into what you hope to get from any of these choices."
insights.article_title: Let realization command your action || IIT Kharagpur (2022)

insights.quote: "Let your dos and don’ts not come from established principles. Let them come from your clear realization."
insights.article_title: Let realization command your action || IIT Kharagpur (2022)

insights.quote: "The awakened person does not live by morality or the prevalent ethical codes. He lives by his consciousness."
insights.article_title: Question Everything: Unlearn for True Freedom! || Acharya Prashant, with IIT-Madras (2023)

insights.quote: "You ask yourself, 'Who am I? What am I here for?' And that which brings me closer to the purpose of my existence is good, right, auspicious, correct."
insights.article_title: Question Everything: Unlearn for True Freedom! || Acharya Prashant, with IIT-Madras (2023)

insights.quote: "Choose the right suffering. I repeat, just take this home: Choose the right suffering."
insights.article_title: If suffer you must, suffer rightly || IIT Bombay (2022)

insights.quote: "Bad choices reinforce your tendency to make bad choices. Equally, right choices strengthen your resolve to make right choices."
insights.article_title: If suffer you must, suffer rightly || IIT Bombay (2022)

how do i make ethical choices in complex.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of rationality, self-awareness, and the need to make choices that align with one's true purpose and consciousness.

how can i overcome fear of new experienc.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "You hold no obligation or responsibility to run after experiences. Just don’t block them and that is sufficient."
insights.article_title: When life lacks the Essential then it tries to compensate with exotic experiences || Acharya Prashant (2015)

insights.quote: "Let life flow through you. It will naturally, without your asking, bring to you so many and such diversity of experiences, which you could have never even thought of."
insights.article_title: When life lacks the Essential then it tries to compensate with exotic experiences || Acharya Prashant (2015)

insights.quote: "Better it is, to face your fear. And facing your fear does not require confidence. It requires faith. It requires devotion."
insights.article_title: How to have confidence in oneself? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2018)

insights.quote: "When you address fear and when you are able to uproot fear, after that you find that not only has fear vaporized, confidence too has gone away."
insights.article_title: How to have confidence in oneself? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2018)

insights.quote: "Fear comes out of what you don’t understand. To understand is to conquer fear."
insights.article_title: How to Overcome Challenges in Decision Making?

insights.quote: "The root to fearlessness is to reduce your dependencies. The less dependent you’re on others the more fearless you’ll feel."
insights.article_title: The deeper is your dependency, the deeper is your fear || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "When fears come, let it pass through you fully. Never try to fight it. Never try to overcome it. Acknowledge it fully."
insights.article_title: Who am I? The honesty with which I admit 'I am my identities' || Acharya Prashant (2016)

how can i overcome fear of new experienc.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of allowing experiences to come naturally, facing fears with faith, and understanding the roots of fear to overcome it.

how do i handle rejection anxiety?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Rejection might be simple, but do you keep it simple? Do you allow it to remain simple? Do you know what ‘simple’ means? Simple means, direct. Simple means, it is what it is. I do not add anything to it, I do not distort it, I do not take away anything from it. Rejection is rejection. But for you is it merely rejection?"
insights.article_title: To Overcome Fear of Rejection, Be Spiritual and Not a Social Slave

insights.quote: "Whenever your own self-worth will be dependent on others and hence limited, you will be constantly eager to get approval. When you want approval and you get rejection, it has a bearing on your very sense of being."
insights.article_title: To Overcome Fear of Rejection, Be Spiritual and Not a Social Slave

insights.quote: "It is not anxiety that bothers you, it is your anxiety about ‘anxiety’. Just as we are afraid of so many things, we are also fearful of ‘fear’ – 'What if I become afraid?' Similarly, we are anxious about anxiety."
insights.article_title: Imaginary fear || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Let anxiety come and go. Why must you resist it? Why must you plan to kill it?"
insights.article_title: Imaginary fear || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Anxiety is thought. The presence of thought implies the lack of attention. All anxiety is imagination."
insights.article_title: What to do with fear and anxiety? || Acharya Prashant (2015)

insights.quote: "Understanding leads to instantaneous action; there is no space left for anxiety."
insights.article_title: What is anxiety?

insights.quote: "You cannot excel in anything which you do not enjoy. So, when you are anxious, just remember that your mind is making a fool of you."
insights.article_title: What is anxiety?

how do i handle rejection anxiety?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of understanding the nature of rejection and anxiety, and how one's self-worth should not be tied to external validation.

can truth be understood through science.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "The only thing that spirituality and science have in common is an honest urge to know the Truth."
insights.article_title: Where Science and Spirituality Converge

insights.quote: "Science is about trying to look at objects, objectively. That’s what Science is – Look at the objects, without prejudice, objectively. That is Science. Spirituality is about looking at the subject and object together."
insights.article_title: Science, Spirituality, and their relationship || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Spirituality is very much like science, in the sense that it looks very closely at the world. Spirituality is extremely scientific because it wants to examine the world and its nature, just like the scientist."
insights.article_title: Spirituality is science turned inwards - it looks at both the subject and object || (2015)

insights.quote: "Spirituality looks not only at that which is outside, but also at that which is apparently inside and looks at the outside."
insights.article_title: How does 'Myth Demolition Tour' relate to Shri Krishna's Law of Karma? || Acharya Prashant (2016)

insights.quote: "Science does not even look into these questions. Science is considered, rather science is concerned only with the objective world. Science does not look into the subject."
insights.article_title: Science or Upanishads: Who Explains Existence Best?

insights.quote: "Spirituality is simply the search for Truth and it is very-very rigorous in the sense that... Truth is that which is not only unchanging within time, but is actually beyond time."
insights.article_title: Spirituality, Observation, Knowing and Knowledge, Seriousness & Immersion

can truth be understood through science.footer: These quotes illustrate the relationship between science and spirituality as described by Acharya Prashant, emphasizing that both seek truth but approach it from different perspectives.

how do i deal with unrequited love?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Do not force yourself into love. You will not succeed. You will only get an unpleasant experience which will make you feel that there is something not good, and for the rest of your life you would not want to go again into it. Instead, watch, understand, and let love come to you."
insights.article_title: Being close to yourself is the closeness to others || Acharya Prashant (2014)

insights.quote: "You are hurt because you do not like what is happening. Your resistance is hurting you."
insights.article_title: Which is More Important: The Person or Love?

insights.quote: "You do not want a person, so that he may cause you disturbance. When you want a person, you actually want peace and contentment through that person, don’t you?"
insights.article_title: How to Recover From a Breakup? || Acharya Prashant (2017)

insights.quote: "Contentment is more valuable than any relationship. Relationships are a medium, contentment is the end."
insights.article_title: How to Recover From a Breakup? || Acharya Prashant (2017)

insights.quote: "You insist on remaining who you are, that is why you are hurt. You insist on remaining who you are, that is why you want that guy back."
insights.article_title: Which is More Important: The Person or Love?

how do i deal with unrequited love?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-awareness, understanding one's own needs, and allowing love to come naturally rather than forcing it.

how to be confident?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "No, you do not need confidence. You need inquiry and honesty. It is better to suspend confidence and conclusions than to be falsely confident."
insights.article_title: How to be more confident in decision-making? || IIT Kharagpur (2021)
