insights.quote: "Confidence is just your belief in a certain concept. You can be confident of that, and if you are confident of that, then you are confident of a concept related to that."
insights.article_title: How to have confidence in oneself? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2018)

insights.quote: "When fear goes away, then confidence too goes away."
insights.article_title: How to have confidence in oneself? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2018)

insights.quote: "Better it is, to face your fear. And facing your fear does not require confidence. It requires faith. It requires devotion."
insights.article_title: How to have confidence in oneself? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2018)

insights.quote: "The question of confidence arises only when you are afraid."
insights.article_title: Don't ask for confidence, ask for fearlessness || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2015)

insights.quote: "Confidence is a disease. A disease that comes to those who are basically afraid."
insights.article_title: Don't ask for confidence, ask for fearlessness || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2015)

insights.quote: "Don’t ask for confidence, ask for fearlessness."
insights.article_title: Don't ask for confidence, ask for fearlessness || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2015)

insights.quote: "You do not need confidence. You need to just get up and speak. Who needs confidence? You are good as you are."
insights.article_title: You do not need confidence || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "Fear arises because you think you have something to lose."
insights.article_title: Of Confidence, Falseness and the Idea of Perfection || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "You must have a certain respect, Love and regard for yourself."
insights.article_title: How to have confidence in oneself? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2018)

how to be confident?.footer: These insights emphasize that true confidence stems from understanding oneself and addressing fears rather than seeking superficial confidence.

why am i depressed?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "The disease is deeper than we think. We feel, 'Oh, it is about a young person probably looking for a friend or a mate.' No, no, no. It is an existential problem. We are lonely because we *exist*. We are dependent—why? Because we exist."
insights.article_title: The real way to deal with dependency || IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "Clinically, only a small proportion of people are depressed; existentially, we are all born depressed. So, there are some who have been diagnosed with depression, and there are some who are asymptomatically depressed, but depressed we all are without doubt."
insights.article_title: Emotional dependency and loneliness || Acharya Prashant, with IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "Depression means – the height is unknown to you. The only height is the Core, the Essence, the Self. The one who does not know the Self, will always be in depression."
insights.article_title: Sad and Depressing: Living Without Knowing The Self

insights.quote: "Whenever you say, 'I got angry'; whenever you say, 'I am depressed,' it is a wrong choice because you are not admitting that you have chosen to be depressed."
insights.article_title: How to avoid wrong choices? || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "You cannot suffer without your consent. Restfulness is your nature. You cannot become restless without your consent."
insights.article_title: Choicelessness is only for those who choose rightly || Acharya Prashant, on Ashtavakra Gita (2018)

why am i depressed?.footer: These insights reflect on the deeper existential nature of depression and the choices we make regarding our emotional states.

what is depression?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Depression means – the height is unknown to you. The only height is the Core, the Essence, the Self. The one who does not know the Self, will always be in depression."
insights.article_title: Sad and Depressing: Living Without Knowing The Self

insights.quote: "The one whose mind is not in contact with That alone, will always be in depression. That pinnacle is a point, its a Center. The one whose life is not centered around that point, will always find himself down."
insights.article_title: Sad and Depressing: Living Without Knowing The Self

insights.quote: "Clinically, only a small proportion of people are depressed; existentially, we are all born depressed."
insights.article_title: The real way to deal with dependency || IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "What you are attempting to give away, is something that cannot be given away; it cannot be traded. It is your Essence."
insights.article_title: Sad and Depressing: Living Without Knowing The Self

insights.quote: "Ours is the situation of a man who trades everything away, and gets nothing in return; double depression, double debit."
insights.article_title: Sad and Depressing: Living Without Knowing The Self

insights.quote: "The real way is to know that as long as we continue to feed our false sense of self, we are condemning ourselves to more and more loneliness, more and more dependency and we are necessitating, therefore, more and more of anti-depressant material."
insights.article_title: Emotional dependency and loneliness || Acharya Prashant, with IIT Bombay (2020)

what is depression?.footer: These insights reflect Acharya Prashant's understanding of depression as a profound existential issue tied to one's connection with the Self and the essence of life.

how to get rid of my depression?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "You don’t need to get rid of it you just need to realize that, 'It is there! It is there!'"
insights.article_title: Why does mind fear change? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "The root of disturbance is within you. Temporarily, a change of surroundings helps reduce the disturbance, but the mere change in external situations cannot help beyond a point"
insights.article_title: Beware of Fake Depression

insights.quote: "Clinically, only a small proportion of people are depressed; existentially, we are all born depressed"
insights.article_title: Emotional dependency and loneliness || Acharya Prashant, with IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "The real way is to know that as long as we continue to feed our false sense of self, we are condemning ourselves to more and more loneliness, more and more dependency"
insights.article_title: Emotional dependency and loneliness || Acharya Prashant, with IIT Bombay (2020)

insights.quote: "If you must hope, hope for the second kind. Hope to find yourself. Hope to get rid of the bondage"
insights.article_title: Acharya Prashant on Two Kinds of Hope

how to get rid of my depression?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-realization and understanding the root causes of one's feelings rather than seeking superficial changes.

how to be happy?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "The common happiness that we know has two characteristics: One, it is an acquired conditioning. And second, it depends on the presence of sadness."
insights.article_title: Happiness cannot be the purpose of life

insights.quote: "If you want to be happy, you should be sad. How many of you want deep happiness? You must go and must become deeply sad."
insights.article_title: Happiness cannot be the purpose of life

insights.quote: "Joy is not a product of conditioning, joy is not a product of anything, joy does not depend upon situations, and joy is not stupid. Joy is reasonless!"
insights.article_title: Happiness cannot be the purpose of life

insights.quote: "Stop trying to be happy. Stop *wanting* happiness. That special happy day will never come. That special day is either right now, or never."
insights.article_title: This futile search for happiness || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "The desire of happiness is the sure shot recipe for unhappiness. The desire of happiness certainly leads to unhappiness."
insights.article_title: This futile search for happiness || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2014)

insights.quote: "You are not here to work hard and attain something. That is not at all why you are here."
insights.article_title: Do success and happiness go together? || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2015)

insights.quote: "If you are a lover of Truth, if you are in the spiritual pursuit, then it becomes a double responsibility upon you to remain highly happy."
insights.article_title: Heaven and Hell are closer than you think

insights.quote: "Happiness is a glimpse. Glimpse of what? Glimpse of the absence of suffering."
insights.article_title: How to Be Happy Everyday?

how to be happy?.footer: These insights emphasize the distinction between transient happiness and deeper joy, urging individuals to seek joy that is independent of external circumstances.

how do i choose the right partner?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Companionship is wonderful. Be with one person, ten persons, anybody who helps your mind be centred. Being with such a person or a group of persons is wonderful."
insights.article_title: How to choose the right partner for marriage? || Acharya Prashant (2018)

insights.quote: "If someone’s presence has a becalming effect on your mind, soothing effect on your mind, illuminating effect on your mind, liberating effect on your mind, go ahead. Boldly be with that person or persons as much as you want to."
insights.article_title: How to choose the right partner for marriage? || Acharya Prashant (2018)

insights.quote: "The right partner is not determined by the attributes of the partner. The right partner is determined and achieved by the intensity of your hunger, your enquiry."
insights.article_title: Searching for the right partner? ||Neem Candies

insights.quote: "You must know what you are seeking from the person. If you get it from that person you are with the right person."
insights.article_title: Waiting for the Right Partner?

insights.quote: "The only Real one for you is the one in whose presence you feel just light, just free, just nobody."
insights.article_title: True Love always involves three || Acharya Prashant, on Hafiz (2016)

insights.quote: "If you discover that you really do need the presence of somebody in your life, first of all, the reasons must be very, very clear."
insights.article_title: Is live-in relationship better than marriage? || Acharya Prashant (2020)

insights.quote: "If you are sorted and liberated go ahead and do whatever you want to, and if you aren’t sorted and liberated, whatever you do would be wrong."
insights.article_title: How to choose the right partner for marriage? || Acharya Prashant (2018)

how do i choose the right partner?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-awareness, clarity of purpose, and the impact of a partner's presence on one's inner state.

how to be successful in life?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on this topic:

insights.quote: "Success does not lie in doing any random thing. That’s the first, the most important, and probably the last thing."
insights.article_title: The way of assured success || Acharya Prashant (2020)

insights.quote: "Choose the right thing to do. In that lies success—in that lies 'immediate' success."
insights.article_title: The way of assured success || Acharya Prashant (2020)

insights.quote: "Immediate success implies that you have been successful right from the moment of the choice itself; you don’t have to wait for the outcome."
insights.article_title: The way of assured success || Acharya Prashant (2020)

insights.quote: "Victory lies in choosing the right road to walk on. It does not lie in reaching the destination earlier than others."
insights.article_title: The way of assured success || Acharya Prashant (2020)

insights.quote: "If you fight the wrong battle, isn’t victory worse than defeat?"
insights.article_title: The way of assured success || Acharya Prashant (2020)

insights.quote: "You must know who you are and what you really need."
insights.article_title: The way of assured success || Acharya Prashant (2020)

insights.quote: "Leave the future, forget the future, forget success; success will come by itself, the future will take care of itself; just be successful right now, forget the future."
insights.article_title: Success is the fullness of this moment || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "Success is the joy of living."
insights.article_title: Success is just an image with no substance || Acharya Prashant, with youth (2013)

insights.quote: "Before you excel, ask yourself, 'What must I excel in? What is worth it?'"
insights.article_title: Effect of repeated failures on the self

insights.quote: "Making the perfect choice is far more important than being perfect at the perfect choice."
insights.article_title: Effect of repeated failures on the self

how to be successful in life?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of making the right choices and being present in the moment rather than chasing arbitrary definitions of success.

how do i deal with breakup?.header: Acharya Ji has shared the following insights on your question:

insights.quote: "You are saying it has broken you completely from the inside. No, you are lying. Had you been completely broken from inside, then there would have been nobody left inside to experience the hurt."
insights.article_title: Which is More Important: The Person or Love?

insights.quote: "The more you hurt it, the more strength it gathers. So, first of all, please understand that you have a lot inside. A lot that has become only more cemented, more solidified after this episode."
insights.article_title: Which is More Important: The Person or Love?

insights.quote: "You are hurt because you do not like what is happening. Your resistance is hurting you."
insights.article_title: Which is More Important: The Person or Love?

insights.quote: "Guys come and go. There is nobody more important than your own peace."
insights.article_title: Breakup? || Neem Candies

insights.quote: "When you want a person, you actually want peace and contentment through that person, don’t you?"
insights.article_title: Which is More Important: The Person or Love?

insights.quote: "If you remain anchored in the past, then you will never come to the new. And this moment is always new."
insights.article_title: How to Get One's Ex-Girlfriend Back?

insights.quote: "You insist on remaining who you are, that is why you are hurt. You insist on remaining who you are, that is why you want that guy back."
insights.article_title: How Will You Have a Fairy-Tale Affair? || AP Neem Candies

insights.quote: "Please, do not remain caught in this cycle. Guys come and go, there is nobody more important than your own peace."
insights.article_title: Which is More Important: The Person or Love?

how do i deal with breakup?.footer: These insights emphasize the importance of self-awareness, letting go of resistance, and prioritizing your own peace and contentment in the aftermath of a breakup.
